trans-unit.source: Represents an object that is used to define the layout of a row of column headers.

This <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewRowPresenter> object and GridViewHeaderRowPresenter objects are support objects for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView.View%2A> mode that displays data in columns for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView>.
For more information about how to define a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> view, see the [GridView Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

You can determine when a column is moving to a new location by monitoring the <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ObservableCollection%601.CollectionChanged> event that is defined for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnCollection>.
You can customize column headers in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> view mode by using a variety of properties that are found in this class and in related classes.
For more information about these properties, and about the precedence between them, see [GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether columns can change positions.

When you implement this class as part of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> view mode, the value of this property is bound to the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.AllowsColumnReorder%2A> property on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if columns can be moved by the drag-and-drop operation of a column header; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.AllowsColumnReorder*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.AllowsColumnReorder%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Arranges the content of the header row elements, and computes the actual size of the header row.
The area that is available for the column header row.
The actual <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> for the column header row.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> to use for the column headers.

When you implement this class as part of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> view mode, the value of this property is bound to the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderContainerStyle%2A> property on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView>.
You can customize column headers in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> view mode by using a variety of properties that are found in this class and in related classes.
For more information about these properties, and about the precedence between them, see [GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
When you set styles, some restrictions apply.
For more information, see the [Styling and Templating](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Property Element Usage ## XAML Values *ResourceExtension* One of the following: `StaticResource`, or `DynamicResource`.
See [XAML Resources](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
*StyleResourceKey* The key that identifies the style being requested.
The key refers to an existing resource in a <xref:System.Windows.ResourceDictionary>.
> [!NOTE] > Property element syntax is technically possible, but not recommended.
See [Inline Styles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A binding reference using or is also possible, but uncommon.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> to use for the column header container.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderContainerStyle*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderContainerStyle%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu"></xref> for the column headers.

When you implement this class as part of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> view mode, the value of this property is bound to the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderContextMenu%2A> property on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView>.
You can customize column headers in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> view mode by using a variety of properties that are found in this class and in related classes.
For more information about these properties, and about the precedence between them, see [GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu"></xref> for the column header row.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderContextMenu*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderContextMenu%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a composite string that specifies how to format the column headers if they are displayed as strings.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn.HeaderTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set, this property is ignored.
You can use several properties to specify the format of the column headers.
If more than one property is set, the column header is formatted with the value of the property that has the highest priority.
The format for a column can be set on several types.

The following list shows the properties that can be used to format the column headers, ordered from lowest to highest priority: - - ColumnHeaderStringFormat - ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to **true**|None|
A composite string that specifies how to format the column headers if they are displayed as strings.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderStringFormat*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the template to use to display the column headers.

When you implement this class as part of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> view mode, the value of this property is bound to the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderTemplate%2A> property on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView>.

If the ColumnHeaderTemplate property and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector%2A> property are both set, the ColumnHeaderTemplate takes precedence.
You can customize column headers in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> view mode by using a variety of properties that are found in this class and in related classes.
For more information about these properties, and about the precedence between them, see [GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Property Element Usage ## XAML Values *ResourceExtension* One of the following: `StaticResource`, or `DynamicResource`.
See [XAML Resources](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
*TemplateResourceKey* The key that identifies the template being requested.
The key refers to an existing resource in a <xref:System.Windows.ResourceDictionary>.
> [!NOTE] > Property element syntax is technically possible, but not recommended.
See [Inline Styles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A binding reference using or is also possible, but uncommon.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DataTemplate"></xref> that is used to display the column header content.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderTemplate*> dependency property.
The identifier for <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderTemplate%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector"></xref> that provides logic that selects the data template to use to display a column header.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderTemplate%2A> property and the ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector property are both set, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderTemplate%2A> takes precedence.

When you implement this class as part of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> view mode, the value of this property is bound to the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector%2A> property on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView>.
You can customize column headers in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> view mode by using a variety of properties that are found in this class and in related classes.
For more information about these properties, and about the precedence between them, see [GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Property Element Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *MyDataTemplateSelectorImplementation* A class derived from that implements a practical override.
For information about how to map your custom class, see [XAML Namespaces and Namespace Mapping for WPF XAML](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
*ResourceExtension* One of the following: `StaticResource`, or `DynamicResource`.
See [XAML Resources](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
*DataTemplateSelectorClassKey* The key that identifies the selector implementation being requested.
The key refers to a derived class that implements a practical <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector.SelectTemplate%2A> override.
For information about how to map your custom class, see [XAML Namespaces and Namespace Mapping for WPF XAML](../Topic/XAML%20Namespaces%20and%20Namespace%20Mapping%20for%20WPF%20XAML.md).
You can also programmatically add an instance of your <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector> class as a resource to a resource dictionary.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector"></xref> that chooses the <xref href="System.Windows.DataTemplate"></xref> to use to display each column header.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the content for a tooltip for the column header row.

When you implement this class as part of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> view mode, the value of this property is bound to the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.ColumnHeaderToolTip%2A> property on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView>.
You can customize column headers in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> view mode by using a variety of properties that are found in this class and in related classes.
For more information about these properties, and about the precedence between them, see [GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Property Element Usage ``` - or - ``` ## XAML Values `toolTipContent` A string that becomes the display text for the ColumnHeaderToolTip.
`toolTipObjectContent` An object to use as the content for the tooltip.
Typically, this object is a <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> or some other element that defines a layout for the ColumnHeaderToolTip, such as a text element.

In this usage, a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolTip> element is implicitly created from the parsed [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], and the `toolTipObjectContent` content is set as its <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
<`ToolTip` .../> See <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolTip>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
An object that represents the content of a tooltip for the column headers.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderToolTip*> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderToolTip%2A> dependency property.
To be added.
Determines the area that is required to display the column header row.
The amount of area that is available to display the column header row.
The required <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> for the column header row.
Creates an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> object for the column header row.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.GridViewHeaderRowPresenterAutomationPeer"></xref> object for this column header row.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.LostMouseCapture"></xref> event for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnHeader"></xref>.
If a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.LostMouseCapture> event occurs while a column is moving to a new position, the move is canceled.
This implementation does not handle the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.LostMouseCapture> event.
The event data.

Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeftButtonDown"></xref> event that occurs when the user presses the left mouse button inside a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnHeader"></xref>.
If <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.AllowsColumnReorder%2A> is `true`, this method prepares a column to be dragged to another location in the column header row.
This implementation handles the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeftButtonDown> event by setting the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> event argument to `true`.
The event data.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeftButtonUp"></xref> event that occurs when the user releases the left mouse button.

If <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.AllowsColumnReorder%2A> is `true`, and if the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeftButtonUp> event occurs after a column is dragged to a new location, the column is moved.
This implementation handles the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeftButtonUp> event by setting the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> event argument to `true`.
The event data.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseMove"></xref> event that occurs when the user moves the mouse.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.AllowsColumnReorder%2A> property is set to `true` and the user presses the left mouse button, this method implements the visual behavior that occurs when the user drags a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnHeader> to a new location.

This method override sets the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> event argument to `true` for the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseMove> event even if the user does not press the left mouse button.
The event data.
